intro: Eschscholzia minutiflora var. darwinensis, commonly known as the Darwin's miniature poppy, is a small annual herb native to California. It features delicate, bright orange to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in coastal scrub habitats. Its botanical significance lies in its role as a rare and endemic species within the Papaveraceae family.
